result.execSummary:
The defendant Devante D Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CT 1. Good time to apply.

Court recommends monitoring through the mental health division of the department.
Probation as to each count concurrent.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Cooperate with the Department. Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample-surcharge waived as the court finds an inability to pay.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No violent contact with Latasha M.
Seek and maintain employment unless on disbility or in school. Obtain HSED / GED.

Court ordered defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
Obtain Mental Health assessment and cooperate with any treatment. Take all prescribed medications.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CT 2. Good time to apply.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devante D Reed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devante D Reed in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Devante D Reed in custody. Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    State files an AMENDED INFORMATION.
Count 1:  the court amended the charge to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1) , a class A MISDEMEANOR. 
Count 2:  the court amended the charge to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 94701(1) , a class B MISDEMEANOR.   kmw
 Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
**********
Statements made as to sentencing.
Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction-concurrent with count 1-good time to apply, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction-concurrent with count 2-good time to apply, with credit for 0 days time served.
These sentences are STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 18 months, each count concurrent with the following conditions:
-Cooperate with the Department
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Court recommends monitoring through the mental health division of the department.
-Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Obtain Mental Health assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Take all prescribed medications
-Seek and maintain employment unless on disbility or in school
-Obtain HSED  GED
-No violent contact with Latasha M.

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample-surcharge waived as the court finds an inability to pay.

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw

Defendant Devante D Reed in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Devante D Reed in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J Erickson in court, defendant Devante D Reed not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Devante D Reed in court with attorney Thomas J. Erickson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status held off record with the court.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devante D Reed in court with attorney Thomas J. Erickson.  Defendant Devante D Reed in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will enter into a DPA.  Bail modified.  Defendant acknowledges terms and conditions of the no contact order.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J. Erickson in court, defendant Devante D Reed not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to lower bail heard and adjourned to allow DE appearance.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devante D Reed in court with attorney Thomas J. Erickson.  Defendant Devante D Reed in custody.  Joy Hammond for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lester T., Jr. and Gloria M. as well as 8900 W. Congress - ALL apartments, grounds and parking losts.

Defendant Devante D Reed in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Devante D Reed in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
